title: SLO rules
description: Schema for defining the SLO rules that apply to a repository

appliesTo.description: Describes what this rule applies to

gitHubLabels.description: Match issues/PRs with these GitHub labels

excludedGitHubLabels.description: Exclude issues/PRs with these GitHub labels

complianceSettings.description: Settings for the SLI to be found compliant

responseTime.description: Matching issues with no response within this timeframe are non-compliant. A number value represents seconds; a string value should be formatted as a number followed by one of: d, h, m, s where d=days, h=hours, m=minutes and s=seconds. A value of 0 is considered as not needing a response.

resolutionTime.description: Matching issues open for longer than this timeframe are non-compliant. A number value represents seconds; a string value should be formatted as a number followed by one of: d, h, m, s where d=days, h=hours, m=minutes and s=seconds. A value of 0 is considered as not needing a response.

requiresAssignee.description: Matching issues require an assignee to be compliant

responders.description: Defaults to people with write access to the repository. If specified, at least one field must be defined and all fields not defined default to none/empty

owners.description: A uri reference to a file containing users marked as responders to this SLO

contributors.description: As defined by GitHub, one of: WRITE|ADMIN|OWNER. All users in the designated group are responders

users.description: An array of users that are responders
